page.title: 05ENERGY
page.content: Townspeople will find it hard to imagine a house where there is no gas, mains water or sewage.This is true of some of the farms in this area.People without mains sewage have cess-pits which are huge tanks underground,that are emptied at intervals by the council workmen.Everyone has electricity and one farm has a wind-pump too.Some farms have their own spring water supply or a bore hole,and in these days, when spring water is costly and advertised as something tasty and special,without any additives,perhaps we should envy the ones who have their own supply.Don't think this portrays a primitive lifestyle.Kitchens are spacious,with modern fitments.Many people said they were happy to live away from the bustle of the towns.
